question: Which principle was established for the first time by the US Supreme Court in deciding McCulloch vs. Maryland Case?
option2: Equality between the Federal Government and States
option3: Supremacy of the States over the Federal Government
option4: Supremacy of the Federal Government over the States
answer: Supremacy of the Federal Government over the States
explanation: McCulloch vs Maryland, US Supreme Court case decided in 1891, in which chief justice John Marshall affirmed the constitutional doctrine of Congress “implied powers”. It determined that Congress had not only the powers expressly conferred upon it by the constitution but also all authority “appropriate” to carry out such powers.
